intro: Asperula, commonly known as woodruff, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, often arranged in clusters. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Asperula species are generally shrubs or subshrubs with opposite, simple leaves. The plant is also known for its use in herbal medicine and as a source of essential oils.
